H0.text: Iron, oxygen, nickel, and copper are common elements found in the organic compounds that make up plants and animals.

H1.text: Sodium, potassium, gold, and hydrogen are the common elements found in the organic compounds that compose plants and animals.

H2.text: Helium, neon, argon, and krypton are the common elements found in the organic compounds that compose plants and animals.

H3.text: Carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, and nitrogen are the common elements found in organic compounds that compose plants and animals.

A4.text: The organic compound L-isoleucine molecule presents some features typical of organic compounds: carbon–carbon bonds, carbon–hydrogen bonds, as well as covalent bonds from carbon to oxygen and to nitrogen.
